Description: A necklace: composed of some cylindrical disc beads and short cylinders of green glazed steatite, a number of large discs of brown steatite, a few cylindrical discs of black and grey limestone and very many of shell. Some of the shell beads are small, others are rather large
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Mostagedda, Grave 2201 Found at the neck of a child
Curator's comments: Also from this burial: bracelet (1929,1015.215). Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 40; pl.XXII, 44; Grave register, pl.IX; Bead corpus, pl.XXXIX, 75B13, 75C15; 86C7, 13, F19, 21, 23, 25, K27, 29, L11, 13, P11, 13, R16.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (49)
